Key Match Events: Canada posted the highest score in New York this T20 World Cup.
Mark Adair and George Dockrell resurrected the Irish innings and put on 62 for the seventh wicket.
Jeremy Gordon and Dilon Heyliger held their own at the death to deliver Canada a famous win.
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland should have restricted Canada to 115-120.
Post-Match Reflections: Canada are the only Full Member team they have beaten in the format.
This was just the third time Canada had beaten Ireland in T20Is.
Miscellaneous Highlights: On an uneven surface and a sluggish outfield, a chase of 138 was always going to be a tricky ask.
There were no full balls, only the hard-length stuff and there was nothing Adair could do.
